Package ui.components

Class MenuSelectionPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.components.MenuSelectionPanel
  • public class MenuSelectionPanel
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      MenuSelectionPanel​(CartPanel cartPanel)
      Constructs a MenuSelectionPanel with a specified CartPanel.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      javax.swing.JPanel getMenuGridPanel()
      Retrieves the menu grid panel containing the menu item buttons.
      javax.swing.JScrollPane getMenuScrollPane()
      Retrieves the scroll pane containing the menu grid panel.
      void makeMenuPanel()
      The `makeMenuPanel` function creates a panel with buttons for each menu item, allowing users to add items to a cart and update the display accordingly.
      void setCartDisplayList​(java.util.List<CartEntry> cartDisplayList)
      Sets the list of cart entries to be displayed in the cart panel.
      void setMenuItems​(java.util.List<MenuItem> menuItems)
      Sets the list of menu items to be displayed in the menu panel.
      void updateMenuPanel()
      Updates the menu panel by clearing existing components and rebuilding it with the current list of menu items.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MenuSelectionPanel

        public MenuSelectionPanel​(CartPanel cartPanel)
        Constructs a MenuSelectionPanel with a specified CartPanel. Initializes the menu grid panel with a grid layout and sets the cart panel reference. The menu items and cart display list are initialized to null and will be set later.
        Parameters:
        cartPanel - the CartPanel to be associated with this MenuSelectionPanel.

    • Method Detail

      • makeMenuPanel

        public void makeMenuPanel()
        The `makeMenuPanel` function creates a panel with buttons for each menu item, allowing users to add items to a cart and update the display accordingly.

      • updateMenuPanel

        public void updateMenuPanel()
        Updates the menu panel by clearing existing components and rebuilding it with the current list of menu items. This method ensures that the UI reflects the latest menu items available for selection.

      • setMenuItems

        public void setMenuItems​(java.util.List<MenuItem> menuItems)
        Sets the list of menu items to be displayed in the menu panel.
        Parameters:
        menuItems - the list of MenuItem objects representing the items to be displayed. This list will be used to populate the menu grid with buttons for each item.

      • setCartDisplayList

        public void setCartDisplayList​(java.util.List<CartEntry> cartDisplayList)
        Sets the list of cart entries to be displayed in the cart panel.
        Parameters:
        cartDisplayList - the list of CartEntry objects representing the items currently in the cart. This list will be used to update and display the cart contents.

      • getMenuGridPanel

        public javax.swing.JPanel getMenuGridPanel()
        Retrieves the menu grid panel containing the menu item buttons.
        Returns:
        the JPanel object representing the menu grid panel, which displays the menu items.

      • getMenuScrollPane

        public javax.swing.JScrollPane getMenuScrollPane()
        Retrieves the scroll pane containing the menu grid panel. This scroll pane allows for vertical scrolling of the menu items.
        Returns:
        the JScrollPane object representing the scrollable menu grid panel.
